data.title: AMP congratulates Emefiele on reappointment as CBN governor
data.meta_description: The Anioma Media Professionals (AMP) has congratulated the Governor of Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) on his reappointment by President Muhammadu Buhari and confirmation by the Senate. In a statement in Lagos by its National Publicity Secretary, Ken Ugbechie, AMP, made up of journalists and media practitioners from Delta North senatorial district, otherwise known as […]
data.meta_site_name: The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News
data.text:
1 hour ago

The Federal Government said it is working to hit target of 5,105 megawatts electricity by end of 2024. The minister of Power, Mr. Adebayo Adelabu, stated this while on a working tour of Calabar Generation Company, a subsidiary of Niger Delta Power Holding Company (NDPHC) yesterday in Odukpani local government area, Cross River State. According…

1 day ago

President Bola Tinubu on Monday, commissioned the first set of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) buses at the Presidential Villa, Abuja. The buses, numbering 20 in the first batch, were produced locally by Innoson Motors. The government had expressed optimism that the buses will help to ease transportation problems, especially in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT)…

1 day ago

In a groundbreaking initiative, the Society of Women in Safety, Health, and Environment - Africa (SOWSHE-A) has announced the inaugural African Women in Environmental, Occupational Health and Safety (EHS) Conference and Awards. Founder of SOWSHE-A, Funmi Adegbola made the announcement in a statement on Sunday. According to the statement, the pioneering event, set to take…

1 day ago

Minister of Aviation and Aerospace Development, Festus Keyamo, has written to his British counterpart to lodge a formal complaint over the row involving Air Peace’s flight operations from the United Kingdom. According to online news medium, The Cable, the minister made the threat in a letter dated August 1, 2024, and addressed to Louise Haigh,…

1 day ago

• NUEE seeks release of abducted member The Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) has demanded an immediate apology from the Federal Government and the police for the unwarranted invasion of its headquarters last week Wednesday. The Congress also called for a forensic security audit of its headquarters to ascertain its safety and continued suitability for…

1 day ago

The Nigeria Deposit Insurance Corporation (NDIC) said it has reimbursed 82.36 per cent of the customers of the defunct Heritage Bank with deposits below the N5 million maximum insured deposit. Disclosing this in a statement yesterday, Director, Communications and Public Affairs, NDIC, Bashir Nuhu, said this was achieved through the use of BVN-linked…

1 day ago

The management of AIPCC Energy Limited, operators of the Edo Refinery and Petrochemicals Company Limited (ERPCL), has raised the alarm on the persistent lack of crude oil despite being a fully functional 1,000 barrels per day stream crude oil refinery. It said that despite the disclosure by the Dangote Refinery on the refusal of…

1 day ago

1 day ago

12 The Vice-Chancellor of Olabisi Onabanjo University (OOU), Ago-Iwoye, Prof. Ayodeji Agboola, said the 42-year-old institution has contributed to manpower development in every sector of the nation’s economy since its establishment. He submitted that the tertiary institution has grown from five faculties to 14, and from fewer than 300 students to 30,000. In a chat…

1 day ago

• Seizes U.S., UK-bound consignments in auto parts, clothes, arrests four Operatives of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA), in a nationwide intelligence, have recovered multi-billion-naira worth of cocaine. The operatives recovered 2.32kg of cocaine concealed in Ghanaian traditional kente materials going to the United Kingdom at a courier firm in Lagos on Monday,…
